title: Former Chelsea keeper and Italy international Marco Amelia set to join AEK Lanarca in Cyprus
text:
CYPRIOT CALLING Former Chelsea keeper and Italy international Marco Amelia set to join AEK Lanarca in Cyprus 
Veteran stopper finally lands a new club after failing to win deal at Sunderland following Blues exit last summer BY PHIL CADDEN Comments EX-CHELSEA goalkeeper Marco Amelia is joining AEK Lanarca in Cyprus. 
Amelia, 34, was released by the Stamford Bridge outfit last summer and has been without a club since. Getty Images 4 Former Chelsea goalkeeper Marco Amelia is joining AEK Lanarca in Cyprus 
The 34-year-old was signed in October 2015 to act as cover for Blues stoppers Thibaut Courtois and Asmir Begovic . 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Amelia will now join the Cypriot side, who are currently fourth in their domestic league. 
The nine-cap Italy international then went on trial at Sunderland in September but failed to win a contract under David Moyes . Getty Images Amelia, pictured in action for AC Milan, is an Italian international and has won nine caps for his country Getty Images Amelia was behind Asmir Begovic, above, as third-choice goalkeeper during his time at Chelsea Getty Images The goalkeeper failed to impress David Moyes enough to win a contract after a trial at Sunderland earlier this season 
Amelia has played for nine different clubs since breaking through into Livorno’s senior side in 2001. 
He was part of Italy’s 2006 World Cup winning squad and also has a Serie A title medal from his time at Milan.
